text: Activation of NF-kappa B by <extra_id_0> interleukin 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in human blood monocytes .

We report here that <extra_id_0> interleukin 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) acts on human blood monocytes by enhancing binding activity of the transcription factor NF-kappa B to its consensus sequence in the 5 ' regulatory enhancer region of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 receptor alpha chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> p55 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

text: Similarly , <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activates NF-kappa B in the human monocytic cell line U 937 , but not in resting human T-cells .
This effect is detectable within 15 min and peaks 1 h after exposure to <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Enhanced NF-kappa B binding activity is followed by functional activation in that inducibility of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 receptor alpha chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is mediated by enhanced NF-kappa B binding and that a heterologous promoter containing the NF-kappa B consensus sequence ( -291 to -245 ) of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 receptor alpha chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene is activated .

text: In addition , <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is capable of increasing transcript levels of the <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene coding for the <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> subunit of the NF-kappa B transcription factor , whereas mRNA levels of the <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> NF-kappa B gene remained unchanged .
